fields.description:
At the moment, linking tickets created among if/else blocks is not possible with Automation.

Unfortunately, there is no workaround apart from having to create issues within the same block then link them.

However, this requires changing all existent blocks in order to avoid issues from being created twice.

 

This feature request is created as a reference to [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1090]
fields.summary: Linking issues among if/else blocks

fields.description: Please add a voice recorder to Jira's mobile app for attaching voice messages. Would be great and more mobile-friendly to allow for comments to be made via a recorded voice message as an alternative to entering comments as a text. See screenshot from android device.
fields.summary: Implement voice message recorder to mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking a screen scheme from the screens page results in 404
It looks like ViewDeleteFieldScheme.jspa?id=[AN_ID] should be ConfigureFieldScreenScheme.jspa?id=[AN_ID]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit screens page e.g. /jira/settings/issues/screens
 # Click on any screen scheme e.g. /secure/admin/ViewDeleteFieldScheme.jspa?id=1

h3. Expected Results
Load screen scheme e.g. /secure/admin/ConfigureFieldScreenScheme.jspa?id=1

h3. Actual Results
404
Oops, you've found a dead link.
Go back to the previous page
Go to the Home Page

h3. Workaround
Go to screen schemes first: /jira/settings/issues/screen-schemes
Then find the screen scheme you wish to view.
fields.summary: Clicking screen schemes link from screens leads to 404

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using a destination URL with port 8443 In automation webhook actions causes a 503 error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule with a webhook action and in the destination URL use port 8443 (possibly extended to other ports)
# Trigger the automation rule

h3. Expected Results
Per [JRACLOUD-76220|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76220] this and other ports should be supported.

h3. Actual Results

The webhook returns a 503 error:

{noformat}
Error publishing webhook. Response HTTP status:
503
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

It appears that using ports 80 and 443 works correctly.
fields.summary: Using a destination URL with port 8443 In automation webhook actions causes a 503 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira Cloud, we have 2 settings that work together:
 * The user *Personal Settings* page, where users can set personal settings
 * The User *Default Settings page* (accessible to admins only), which defines a set of setting that are going to be used by default for:
 ** All new users
 ** Users who never change their own settings in 'Personal Settings' page.

Due to changes in Personal Settings, there are 2 settings that still exist in 'User Default Settings' and *used to* exist in 'Personal Settings' page, but not anymore (those settings are still available in Jira Server):
 * Number of Issues displayed per Issue navigator page
 * Default sharing for filters and dashboards

The consequence of that is that these 'default settings' apply to all new users now and you can't have a single user with a different setting, as they can't change those in their personal settings.

Another side effect is that if users ever modified those setting while they were available before, they are *stuck* with their original setting, as they can't modify them anymore and default settings won't apply to them (as they only apply if you never modified those settings).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any Jira site and access your Personal Settings

h3. Expected Results

You can modify those setting.
h3. Actual Results

You won't see those 2 setting.

You can still set those setting as *default user settings*, but that applies to all users, except for any possible old user that modified their personal settings when it was possible. For those users, they are stuck with their original choices.
h3. Workaround

Those personal settings can still be delete using REST API, but only by the user itself:
 * [Delete preference|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-myself/#api-rest-api-3-mypreferences-delete] - to delete and start using the system default

Curl example using DELETE and the 'Default sharing for filters and dashboards' setting:
{code}
curl -D- -u <email address>:<token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https:/site.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/mypreferences?key=user.default.share.private
{code}

DELETE for 'Number of Issues displayed per Issue navigator page' property:
{code}
curl -D- -u <email address>:<password> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://site.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/mypreferences?key=user.issues.per.page
{code}
fields.summary: Users may be unable to undo preference changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Linked issues are strikethrough when it is transition to Done status category without resolution
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project with 2 issues (A and B)
 # Add a status with "Done" category and make sure no "Resolution" set
 # Link 2 the issues with any link (ie. Blocking)
 # Transition one of the issues (issue B) to the above status so it's in "Done" category status without any Resolution value set.
 # Open the other issue (issue A) and notice linked issue (B) is strikethrough
 #* Old issue view
 **  !Screenshot 2021-06-30 at 17.17.19.png|thumbnail!  
 #* New issue view
 ** !Screenshot 2021-06-30 at 17.17.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Issues are not strikethrough
h3. Actual Results

Issues are strikethrough
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Linked issues are strikethrough when it is transition to Done status category without resolution

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
While creating a version from a field, the value searched is not used.
h3. Suggested Solution
Update the issue view so it works as the old one:
* Current behaviour
 !Screen Recording 2021-06-30 at 03.50.39 PM.gif|thumbnail! 
* Expected behaviour
 !Screen Recording 2021-06-30 at 03.55.19 PM.gif|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Use the search value while creating a new version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue View has missing elements for accessibility

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue on the new issue view
# Use W.A.V.E. to scan the page

h3. Expected Results
There are no missing elements for accessibility in the issue.

h3. Actual Results
There are several missing alternative texts, labels and a few empty buttons:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue View has missing elements for accessibility

fields.description:
Currently the *Scheduled* automation trigger can be set to run without providing any issues to the automation rule (no trigger issue or JQL); however, if you want to create issues in the rule and use the Link Issues action to link the issue created in the previous execution with the one created in the current one, the automation trigger detects the action as one that requires an issue to be provided to the rule upon execution.

Perhaps the scheduled trigger can have an option added to use the previously created issue as the initial  issue for the rule.
fields.summary: Add the ability to use the Scheduled trigger and link a new issue created by the rule with the previously created one

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In order to share a dashboard, you need the global permission *Share dashboards and filters*.

But currently the option to share a dashboard is still displayed for users that do not have that permission:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-29 at 13.36.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Click on the ellipses button on the top right when viewing a dashboard -> *Edit and share*:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-29 at 13.36.30.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The options to edit the dashboard information will be displayed, but not the ones to share the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results

The options to share the dashboard are displayed.

When you click on *Save*, nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Option to share dashboard still displayed for users with no Share dashboards and filters global permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is not able to see comments unless _Add Comments_ permission is granted
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a company-managed project in which your user have Browse Projects permission
 # Be sure your user does not have _Add Comments_ permission
 # Access any issue

You will see that comments tab are not available to be viewed:

!image-2021-06-29-12-47-57-629.png|width=298,height=313!

However, once _Add Comments_ permission is granted to the user, the tab is shown again.
h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to at least view the comments.
h3. Actual Results

Comments tab is not even able to be selected.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users are not able to see comments unless Add Comments permission is granted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading an image using CTRL+V will show broken review if the image is not fully uploaded. There is no check on making sure that the image was completely uploaded.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on create
 # Enter all mandatory fields first
 # Go to description
 # Copy image from system using CTRL + C and CTRL + V to paste it to the description box.
 # Quickly click on create button right after pasting the image.

h3. Expected Results

Image should have been pasted
h3. Actual Result

Broken preview

*Suggestion* is to disable create issue button unless an attachment is fully added.
fields.summary: Disable create issue button until an attachment is fully uploaded

fields.description: When creating similar Epics with similar Stories and Tasks for different projects (let's say each project represents a customer, it would be useful to have a template which creates a whole new System of Epics and Stories and Tasks just by typing an new name.
fields.summary: Epic Template

fields.description: We have a business-critical requirement to automate issues move from one project to another based on certain conditions. We are using the Automation app in order to build the orchestration but it requires the REST API access in order to perform move action in JIRA Cloud. Could you please provide the API details?
fields.summary: Moving an issue to another project via REST API

fields.description:
In the Old issue view, users had an option to resize the Note section of the Share window.
 This option is not available in the New issue view.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

It would be nice to include the ability to resize the share window so the users can view the message clearly.

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: In the New-issue view, the Note section of the Share window can't be resized.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The search option does not list the recent filters as described in the dropdown message (RECENT BOARDS, PROJECTS, FILTERS AND PLANS). See the attached snapshot.

h3. Environment
JS
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Click on search on the top
Look at the heading RECENT BOARDS, PROJECTS, FILTERS AND PLANS under the dropdown that comes up.
Create a new filter and come back to this view and no filter shows up.


h3. Expected Results
As per the message, the recent filters should show up on the search option

h3. Actual Results
No filters are shown

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Search option is missing the recent filters as mentioned in the dropdown message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing the worklog removes the time spent value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a worklog on an issue and add some value to the time spent field. 
 # Edit the same worklog and add some comments and then save it.

h3. Expected Results

Only the comment should be updated.

h3. Actual Results
The time spent value is updated to zero.

h3. Workaround
For the time being, please be mindful of copy-pasting the time spent value while you save it.
fields.summary: Editing the worklog removes the time spent value.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When the action on an issue triggers a rule, there's no indicator the rule was executed and what was the result.
For example, if the rule triggered generates a new ticket, the person who took the initial action won't be aware unless the they refresh the page and check the logs.

h3. Suggestion
Add a pop up (with a custom message, preferably) to inform a rule was executed and its result.
fields.summary: Display a pop up notification when the rule is run on the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an Org & Site admin uses the 'Log in as user' button to change the Personal Settings of a Basic user, the same settings are applied to that user after switching back to his profile.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click *Log in as user* button for a Basic license user and go to *Personal Settings*.
 # Toggle *Email notifications for issue activity* for the user and *Save changes*.
 # Switch back to the original profile and then go to its *Personal Settings*.

Notice how the same settings are applied to the original profile as well.

h3. Expected Results
The settings should not be applied to the original user

h3. Actual Results
The settings are copied for the original user

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the Personal Settings of a user using the 'Log in as user' feature changes the same for the parent user

fields.description:
[Average Age Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Average+Age+Report] are configured to take on either a *Project* or a *Saved Filter*.

!Screenshot 2021-06-29 at 12.16.37 PM.png|width=228,height=145!

Are there any plans on introducing an option to "exclude" weekends / non-working days? Perhaps something like the button in the *GreenHopper* Burndown Chart?
!Screenshot 2021-06-29 at 12.17.17 PM.png|width=388,height=168!
fields.summary: Average Age Report to exclude weekend / non-working days

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
New issue view is breaking the auto-push for attachments when using the Salesforce connector, the reason is because attachments are being added as comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the Salesforce connector installed and integrated with a Salesforce account
 # Create the binding between the Salesforce account and a project
 # Create an issue in Jira Cloud and associate it by creating a new Salesforce object
 # Add an attachment while in the new issue view by drag and drop or any other method

h3. Expected Results
Attachment is immediately pushed to the Salesforce object automatically like in the old issue view

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is not pushed automatically

h3. Workaround
Open the Salesforce associations menu within the issue and click to Push manually

h3. Other notes
This also affects Jira Software when attachments are added through comments, but you can still attach files directly into the ticket without issues to automatic push to Salesforce.
fields.summary: New issue view is breaking the auto-push for attachments when using the Salesforce connector

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transitioning issues to statuses of status category Done results in Strikethroughs in the parent issue child list while the resolution field populated should be the reason for it instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a transition to a status of Done category that doesn't populate the resolution field in your workflow
 # Create a child issue
 # Transition the child issue to the respective status of your workflow mentioned earlier
 # Check the parent issue view and notice the strikethrough in the issue even though there is no resolution set

You might need to refresh the page to see changes.

h3. Expected Results
Strikethrough should be added only upon resolution field filled in and removed if resolution field is cleared as well.

h3. Actual Results
Strikethrough considers status category of the current status of the issue 

h3. Workaround
See the parent issue using the Old View while still available.
fields.summary: Strikethrough's appear on the Parent Issues child list despite that the Status' Transition sets the Resolution to be Cleared
Ability to Link Confluence Pages from Custom Field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You should not be able to name a custom field the same as a reserved system field name, however, If you Change profile language to another language, in the example, I am using Portuguese, the System fields "Summary" and "Description" are translated to “Resumo” and “Descrição”, this allows you to then create Custom fields named "Summary" and "Description" and save a screen with the duplicate field names reserved for the system fields. When changing back to English, or if another user with English as their profile language, logs in it shows an error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the [my language |https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] settings to a language that *is not English .*
 # go to the project settings page, choose issue type, e.g. Story, and create custom fields named *"Description"* and *"Summary"*
 # Either set Language back to English or log in as a separate user with the language set to English.
 # Go back to the Settings page for Story

h3. Expected Results

User is not permitted to duplicated the reserved system name fields "Summary" or Description" at reproduction step 2
h3. Actual Results
 * 4 red error icons that filed names are wrong.

{noformat}
You're trying to create a field with the same name.  Rename it, or remove it and use this one instead
{noformat}
h3. !Screen Shot 2021-06-28 at 14.40.08.png|width=274,height=224!
h3. Workaround

You must change the language setting back to the alternate language to be able to Delete the duplicate fields or rename them to something like "Summary2" and "Description2" and save any changes due to the error preventing saving the setting change
fields.summary: Changing Language settings allows duplication of the system fields Summary and Description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For JQL of type “status was X after Y OR status was A after B” returns issues which do not satisfy neither of the conditions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Advanced issue search , run the JQL “status was X after Y or status was A after B” , as an example Status was "In Progress" after "2021/06/01" OR Status was "Resolved" AFTER "2021/06/01"

h3. Expected Results

Should return Jira issues which fall in either of the above OR conditions.
h3. Actual Results

We see results/issues which do not fall in either of the conditions. Neither "status was X after Y" nor "status was A after B", when run individually.
h3. Workaround

Use "Changed to" instead of Was operator. For example, JQL -> _Status was "In Progress" after "2021/06/01" OR Status was "Resolved" AFTER "2021/06/01"_ can be written as -> _Status changed TO "In Progress" after "2021/04/01" or status changed TO "Resolved" after "2021/04/01"_, which returns as expected.

Note that the doc:[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-operators/] mentions we can use predicates like After with Was Operator.
fields.summary: Using OR with "Status was after" returns unexpected results.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user restricts the visibility to any of the profile information (e.g. timezone), apps don't have access to such informations.

This limits the ability for apps to provide the functionalities required by the users.
h3. Suggested solution

User have the option to provide consent to apps to access the user profile information. If the consent is not given, apps are provided a mechanism to understand if the information for that user profile is restricted.


h3. Notes about the current behaviour
The current behaviour is described on the https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/profile-visibility/ documentation for Jira.

This applies to cases where the profile information is restricted in either of the two ways: Organization and Only you

h3. Difference between calling the same REST API from the browser or from an app
This behaviour only applies to requests done by apps. Requests done directly from the browser (e.g. for a GET when the user is entering the URL in the browser address bar) or via curl without the header below are not affected.
The difference is that, for a connect app, the request is performed with the additional {{'ap-client-key: \{existing_and_installed_app_key\}'}} header. When this header is present, the profile visibility applied rules applied to apps will restrict the visibility of the profile information.
fields.summary: Apps should be allowed to access restricted user profile information if the user provided consent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira APIs return the site timezone (instead of the user timezone) when the user profile restricted the visibility of the timezone field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the timezone to +5 for a Jira instance

 # Create a new user with timezone +0 that belongs to an organization.

 # Run the following command (manually or via a REST API request performed by an app)

 
{code:java}
curl 'https://{jira_instance}.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/myself' \
-H 'ap-client-key: {existing_and_installed_app_key}' \
-H 'cookie: {created_user_cookie}' \ 
-compressed
{code}
h3. Expected Results

The api returns an indication that the timezone field is restricted (e.g. an empty value).
h3. Actual Results

The api returns the site timezone (+5 in this example) instead of the user one or an empty value.

*Notes*

If the request is performed without the ap-client-key , then the user setting value is returned. (note: the header is present in the requests performed via connect apps).
h3. Workaround

 

Follow the [App Privacy Documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/profile-visibility/#connect-apps] and use [AP.user.getTimeZone|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jsapi/user/] javascript API to get the current user timezone.
fields.summary: Jira APIs return an incorrect timezone value when the user profile restricted the visibility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, the group search is not consistent across Jira. In some places, it is case sensitive, in others not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for a group in User Management:
!image-2021-06-28-11-23-33-310.png|width=225,height=120!
 # Search in Global permissions:
!image-2021-06-28-11-24-07-963.png|width=226,height=89!
!image-2021-06-28-11-24-24-344.png|width=238,height=101!
!image-2021-06-28-11-24-43-686.png|width=239,height=113!

h3. Expected Results

Group search to be consistent
h3. Actual Results

Inconsistency in group search
h3. Workaround

Search for group names excluding the first character.
Perform an exact search
fields.summary: Make group search consistent

fields.description: As a Jira administrator to have the ability to disable gadgets that I do not wish user be able to add to the dashboard
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator to have the ability to disable gadgets that I do not wish user be able to add to the dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The search option does not list the recent filters as described in the dropdown message (RECENT BOARDS, PROJECTS, *FILTERS* AND PLANS). See the attached snapshot.

h3. Environment
JS
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Click on search on the top right.
Look at the heading RECENT BOARDS, PROJECTS, FILTERS AND PLANS under the dropdown that comes up.
Create a new filter and come back to this view and no filter shows up.


h3. Expected Results
As per the message, the recent filters should show up on the search option

h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Search option is missing the recent filters as mentioned in the dropdown message

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time we only can branch over a set of Jira issues and do a set of actions within the branch
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to branch for each field value. Example use-cases.
*  For each version - send a webhook
*  For each component - create a sub task
*  For each user in custom field - send an sms
*  For each checkbox selected - create an issue
*  For number field create a sub-task for each
*  For each comment, perform an action. 
*  For each request participant, add as customer
fields.summary: Ability to iterate / loop over each value in multivalue field or issue field changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Email notifications in text format do not reflect the user's time zone setting. It will not occur when the email format is set to HTML. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your person al time zone setting to JST (GMT +09:00).
 # Other user edits the comment of the issue at 09:00 AM JST
 # Receive a notification letting you know that the comment has been edited

h3. Expected Results
The content of the notification will be as follows
* TEST-USER edited comment on CK-1 at 6/25/21 09:00 AM

h3. Actual Results
The content of the notification will be as follows
* TEST-USER edited comment on CK-1 at 6/25/21 *00:00 AM*

h3. Workaround
Change the email notification format form text to HTML from the following page
https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
fields.summary: Email notifications in text format do not reflect the user's time zone setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL query Custom field is empty search not working with contexts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create custom field A with name "*Account*" as "select list (single choice)
# under Context assign to "project A"
# add options ("account 1", "Account2")

# create custom field B with same name "*Account*" as "select list (single choice)
# under Context assign to "project A"
# add options ("account 1", "Account2")

Under project A, assign a value to field "Account", for other issues leave EMPTY. 
Search in JQL: {code} project = "project A" and "Account[Dropdown]" is EMPTY {code}

h3. Expected Results
Issues with Field Account Empty should be show

h3. Actual Results
JQL Result: "No issues were found to match your search"

h3. Workaround
Rename the custom field for project B to something else
fields.summary: JQL query Custom field is empty search not working with contexts

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Jira Server protects access to its administrative functions by requiring a [secure administration session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-secure-administrator-sessions-861254024.html] in order to use the JIRA administration screens. When a JIRA administrator (who is logged into JIRA) attempts to access an administration function, they are prompted to enter their passwords again.

This feature is currently not available in Jira Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to enable/disable secure administration sessions in Jira Cloud

h3. Workaround
No workaround at this time
fields.summary: Allow admins to enable/disable secure administration sessions in Jira Cloud
Attachment section is not loading for specific users

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if we could branch within branches.

For example, 'transition subtask based on another subtask transitioning'

This use case would be solved much easier with this feature.
fields.summary: Add ability to branch within a branch

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Customer using Jira cloud app and when using IOS , he receives a  "An unspecified HTTP 400 error occured" when transitioning the case which has a screen associated. This issue is not replicable on Android.

h3. Environment
IOS
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
create a screen with a field ( ex: comments)
Use this screen for a transition in the workflow. 
Install Jira cloud app in IOS
Access any issue which has a screen during a transition in an IOS device
When you transition from IOS, instead of the screen an error pops up as below
"An unspecified HTTP 400 error occured"


h3. Expected Results
  The transition screen should come up, when making a transition.   

h3. Actual Results
An error is returned in IOS

h3. Workaround
Not known

h3. Notes
fields.summary: "An unspecified HTTP 400 error occured" on IOS devices when using a transition screen.

fields.description:
When going to a projects option "Issues", you can see a basic search that allows you to search and filter from the issues in that project: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This is fine, but when you want to do a more complex search or customize the columns, you have to jump t the Advanced search.

The suggestion is to simply integrate all the advanced search functionalities in the Issues option, so it is no longer required to jump to the advanced search every time, *OR* at least allow the columns to be customized which would already help with visibility, for example, being able to see the parent-child relation.
fields.summary: Upgrade the Project Issue search function to have all functionality from the advanced search

fields.description: Availability to auto-refresh Filters created and default filters from the system as if a user updates an issue this will not reflect the Filter unless you manually refresh the filter.
fields.summary: Availability to auto-refresh Filters created and default filters

fields.description: When using list view on a Jira Business project or work management project, component is not available column or filter. The project can define components but they are only usable in filters and not in any views of the project issues.
fields.summary: Add component column to list view in Work Management

fields.description:
It would be awesome if we could hide the *Show Done Epic* checkbox on the issue create screen:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-23 at 13.21.48.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hide Show Done Epic Checkbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New issue view .(dot) menu is not efficient, needs more clicks than what was needed in the Old issue view to perform any action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

To log work in the Old issue view, one needs to type . Log <enter> , type time <enter>. This would save the value entered.

The same action takes multiple mouse clicks, even when "Save" option is highlighted in blue, pressing <enter> would not work, it needs to be saved by a mouse click. Customer is unhappy and believes that this is a regression.

An example of the difference : [^Screen Recording 2021-06-23 at 7.57.42 PM.mov]

This problem reported by the user is a continuation of JRACLOUD-71827
fields.summary: New issue view .(dot) menu is not efficient, needs more clicks than what was needed in the Old issue view to perform any action.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleted Issue Type is still associated to a Workflow on Workflow Schemes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete an Issue Type

h3. Expected Results
Workflows associated with that Issue Type are removed from Workflow Schemes

h3. Actual Results
A blank square is shown associated with a workflow on the Workflow Scheme page, and it is not possible to edit the scheme in any way.

h3. Workaround

Contact Support
fields.summary: Deleted Issue Type is still associated to a Workflow on Workflow Schemes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Message custom field cannot be copied via a workflow post function

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a message custom field
 # Set a default value to the field (any text)
 # Edit a workflow and edit the post function for a create transition
 # Configure to copy the message custom field to any other field (ie. description).

h3. Expected Results

The default text from the field should be copied to the destination field.

h3. Actual Results

No items are copied.

h3. Workaround

Option 1 : Use Jira automation to set the target field after creation
Option 2 : Use a custom field single text field with default value configured as a source.
fields.summary: Message custom field cannot be copied via create transition post function

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a select list custom field is restricted to issue types as well as projects, their options aren't available for selection in *Basic Search*. 

This has been reproduced in some scenarios:
* *Select List(Single Choice)* and *Select List(Multiple Choice)* and restricted in context to _both_ a project as well as an issue type. 
* *Select List(Cascading)* and restrict it only to issue types (global projects)

The dropdown is available though, if we switch to *Advanced Search*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field which is restricted in context as described
 # Navigate to *Basic Search* and select the project and the issuetype which are in the context of the custom field.
 # Add the custom field in the search and try to select an option.

Replication video:
 !Screen Recording 2021-06-23 at 06.14.42 PM.gif|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

A dropdown with the configured options should come up.
h3. Actual Results

There are no options in the dropdown.
h3. Workaround

Switch to *Advanced Search*.
fields.summary: Basic search does not populate options for select list custom fields with issue type restrictions in context

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Linked Issue column is only showing the Linked Issue:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
It would be great if the column can include further information of the Linked Issue such as the Status.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the Linked Issue column to include more information such as Status of the Linked Issue

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow Linked Issue column in Issue Navigator to show the Linked Issues' Status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a team-managed project, when using a post function to update the field "Label" for transitioning between statuses, it overwrites the existing value of the label field, and the previously added labels on that issue are removed.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and add a label.
# Now create a post function rule to update the "label" field for a particular transition. 
# Include the desired label in this rule.
# Transition the newly created issue to execute the post function rule.

h3. Expected Results
The new label should get added in the label field along with the previously added label. 

h3. Actual Results
The newly added label overwrites the previously added label. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Update field" post function for field "Labels" in a team-managed project does not work as expected.

fields.description: I can only add existing fields to screens. However, in some occasions it is helpful to add explanatory texts, notifications or other information for board users the screen is shown to. Therefore to edit a text field for each tab which can provide this additional info would be helpful.
fields.summary: Enable adding text field to screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Cloud [configure-issue-security-schemes|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-issue-security-schemes/] documentation page is missing the requirement of having the "Security Level" field be part of the screen. If the field is missing in the screen then the user won't be able to see the "padlock" icon on the issue screen. 

This has been mentioned in DC and Server documentation.
 !Screenshot 2021-06-23 at 1.02.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
NA

h3. Expected Results
The document should mention the required step.

h3. Actual Results

NA

h3. Workaround

Refer to the DC and Server documentation - https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-issue-level-security-938847117.html
fields.summary: Documentation Bug in the configure the Issue Security scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on "View Users" for groups in Jira Global Permission does not show users in group. Instead, the group overview page is shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to "Settings" > "System" > "Global permissions"
 # Click on "View Users" for a group
 !image-2021-06-21-17-16-37-979.png|thumbnail! 
 # Groups overview page is shown
 !image-2021-06-21-17-17-40-817.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on "View Users" should move to the group's user list page

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on "View Users" moves to the groups overview page

h3. Workaround
With the additional step to click on the group, you can see the users list of the group.
fields.summary: Clicking on "View Users" for groups in Jira Global Permission does not show users in group

fields.description:
We use Jira and customers often add comments to issues by replying to an email that they got which was triggered by a previous comment.

This email includes icons that Jira itself inserts, e.g., a Jira icon, a checkbox icon, and a "view issue" icon.

As a result, every time someone does this, the following three bogus attachments get added to the issue: !image-2021-06-22-12-55-52-985.png!

An easy and obvious improvement would be for Jira to have a special rule to not auto-attach to a Jira issue any email attachments that are identical to icons that are sent by Jira itself in notification emails.
fields.summary: Ignore JIRA email icons when auto-importing attachments from email replies

fields.description:
h3.  
h3. *Problem*

On the new issue view, it's not possible to select Seconds, even if the Advanced settings and Look and feel have the correct settings to show such information.

On the old view, it was possible to edit such information, but due to issues and limitations on the new view, the date settings are not respected anymore.
h3. *Suggestion*

Show the date time format added to the advanced settings/look and feel.

*Advanced settings:*

jira.date.time.picker.java.format - dd/MMM/yy h:mm a s

jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format - %e/%b/%y %I:%M %p %S

*Look and feel:*

Complete Date/Time Format - dd/MMM/yy h:mm a s
fields.summary: Ability to select Seconds on Date Time Picker custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

When using the option of CODE on top of the smart-link, it should disable smart-link and have the url text in place.

!image-2021-06-22-16-00-57-447.png|width=281,height=174!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a filepath containing a domain e.g. "M:\foo\www.example.com\bar\foobar"
 # Paste into issue comment or issue description
 # Mark the pasted filepath as "code"

h3. Expected Results:

The text should not be smart link now and in the CODE format.

!image-2021-06-22-15-59-13-520.png|width=282,height=64!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-06-22-15-57-19-267.png|width=363,height=84!
h3. Workaround

After pasting the link/url Press Ctrl + Z (Windows) or Cmd + Z (MacOS) which will revert the link to a normal blue link.
fields.summary: Automatically remove all auto-smart links when marking as inline-code

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Recently Created Chart gadget results, the period(date) column is not sorted correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Recently Created Chart gadget to a Dashboard
 # Configure the Gadget with the below settings:
 ## Add filter
 ## Select period as Daily
 ## Enter Days to be shown in the graph, ensure the days selected are more than 31
 # Save the settings
 # Set the language preference to French
 # Maximize the Gadget, sort Period column.

h3. Expected Results

The Date should be sorted according to the day(number), month, and year.
h3. Actual Results

Dates are sorted based on the Day field first(numerically) and then the month(alphabetically) and the date format is not respecting the Look and Feel configuration.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Set the language preference to English locale.
fields.summary: In the Recently Created Chart gadget results, the period(date) column is not sorted correctly when the locale is set to non English locale

fields.description:
When you try to create subtasks from inline (adding summary) and there are required fields, the Create Issue Screen associated will pop up. It will not keep the Sub-Task issue type you had selected when this happens.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # The project needs to have more than one sub-task type.
 !image-2021-06-21-12-26-38-079.png|width=615,height=328!

 # Try to create a subtask adding the summary inline:
 !image-2021-06-21-12-30-15-249.png|width=643,height=319!
 # The pop-up screen doesn't keep the same Subtask type.
 !image-2021-06-21-12-28-45-959.png|width=616,height=558!

h3. Workaround

Manually select the subtask on the Create Issue Screen.
fields.summary: Keep the same Sub-Task type from inline creation when Create issue screen pops-up due to mandatory fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian update on June 21st*

Hi everyone, thanks so much for your suggestions.

You can now see a new *dropdown box* that allows users to sort issues under *epic issues* (company managed projects) and *child issues* (team managed projects). The following sort options could be available to you, based on your specific project setup:
 * Created (most recent first)

 * Key (alphabetically then numerically)

 * Priority (same order specified in the global admin - only available when the “parent issue” also has the priority field visible)

 * Status (first by status category - to do, in progress, then done - and then alphabetically

 * Assignee (alphabetically then unassigned)

 * Default (current order, “ranking” - for example, what was set in a board)

*Atlassian Product Team*
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40929].
{panel}
Today we don't have the ability to reorder the Issues in Epic when viewing a ticket.
 It would be great if we can rank them like we do with the Sub-Tasks (see attached).

Also, it would be helpful to have a header column to the "Issues in this epic" section of an epic where the users could sort by issue key, ID, or summary
fields.summary: Ability to change the order of the Issues in Epic

fields.description:
On June 21 2021, an update was released to resolve JRACLOUD-40929 (which was opened 18 November 2014). That update which adds some sort options does not resolve the issue.

The point is for the user to choose which issue is #1, which is #2, which is #3 all the way to the last issue not to sort according to a few pre-defined options. This could be achieved by for example allowing issues to be dragged up and down to reorder them.
fields.summary: Move issues up and down in Epic to any desired position

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation for Jira does not automatically map issue types when cloning issues among Team-managed projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule (can be triggered by JQL) that clones issues from one team-managed project into another
 # Run the automation.

h3. Expected Results

!image-2021-06-21-18-48-37-560.png|width=916,height=149!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-06-21-18-49-34-305.png|width=952,height=136!
h3. Workaround

In the Clone Issue action, select an issue type. Repeat for all issue types you want to clone.
 (that is how I got the first screenshot above)
fields.summary: Using A4J to clone issues from a team-managed project into another does not automatically map issue types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Large workflow diagrams become slower as they grow when viewing or editing workflows. This experience happens on Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge and Apple Safari, latest versions, which are Webkit based browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have a large workflow (around 50+ statuses and 100+ transitions)
 # Go to the workflows section under Jira administration
 # Open the large workflow

h3. Expected Results
The workflow diagram loads in a few seconds.

h3. Actual Results
The workflow diagram keeps loading and the browser for more than a minute sometimes and will even throw a message stating that the web page is stuck.

h3. Workaround
Mozilla Firefox does not present these performance issues.
fields.summary: Large workflow diagrams become slower as they grow when viewing or editing workflows

fields.description: With over *5,500 votes*, Dark Mode is a massively desired feature by the community. However, the assignee for the existing issue left the company with no-one taking over, leading to a stall in any kind of progress. It's been 5 years since the issue was proposed and yet Jira has no Dark Theme on cloud. I know several people who have switched for this reason, and I am considering doing so myself after having paid for Jira for a few years – it's that big a deal. When every application and website except for Jira is nice and dark, it's painful to have bright white light blast one's retinas especially at night!
fields.summary: A dark theme for Jira Cloud - dark background, contrasting text, etc

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

When filling up a Date/Time field on the new issue view, the Time isn't being automatically set with the system's time as it used to be on the old view.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Add the ability to, when adding the date, bring the system's time to the field.
fields.summary: Set Time automatically when filling Date/Time fields

fields.description:
limit each project's templates a user can see based on the product access


 !image-2021-06-21-13-58-45-540.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: limit each project's templates a user can see

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When cloning an issue through Automation rule, the security level is copied even though this is not applied to the destination project, what makes the created issues unaccessible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a security scheme and apply this to project A
 # Create a security scheme and apply this to project B
 # Build an Automation rule using Clone action, being issue from project A the trigger issue and cloning this to project B
 # Make sure security level is applied to the trigger issue and that this security level is not applied to project B
 # After the Clone Issue action, add a Most recently created issue branch and within this add any action as Log Action, for example
 # Automation rule won't be able to find any issue within branch even though an issue was successfully created by the rule

!image-2021-06-21-14-41-22-933.png|width=481,height=197!
h3. Expected Results

Since security level is not applied and available in created issue's project, an error message should be shown and issue should not be created.
h3. Actual Results

When cloning the issue in project B, the security level value is copied even though this is not available in project B. Due to this, the created issue is unavailable to be accessed, even though the user has the needed permissions.
h3. Workaround

Inside Clone Issue action, make sure to set a specific value for Security Level to avoid this to copy the trigger issue value. It's also set this as Empty in a way to clear the field in a way no Security Level is applied to the issue: https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApuzzZAQ
fields.summary: When cloning an issue through Automation rule, security level value is copied even though the security level is not available in the created issue's project

fields.description:
I want to create a workflow that requires an approval, much like the option in Service projects. (https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/add-an-approval-to-a-workflow/)

 

I have tried manipulating my Software workflow with Triggers and Conditions, but nothing seems to allow me to add a simple (X needs to approve before changing to next status) Approval.
fields.summary: Approval process in Software projects

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, we are using the using the workaround mentioned in the below documentation to bulk create new components:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-bulk-import-components-into-jira-720418562.html]

But, this doesn't help to add a Description or Component Lead for the newly created components

*Suggested Solution*

Separate option to bulk upload Components and Versions with details like Description, Component Lead, etc

 *Workaround*

Need to update each component manually
fields.summary: Ability to bulk upload Components and Versions with details like Description, Component Lead, etc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

People field changes are not visible on the History tab on team-managed projects via UI.

It shows the changes via API when using [https://domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/KEY-123/changelog]


!Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 11.35.45.png|width=480,height=162!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On an issue type, add a custom field of the type “People”.
 # On a ticket, change the values of the field.

h3. Expected Results

It shows the previous and the new value on the History tab.

!Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 11.29.51.png|width=433,height=109!
h3. Actual Results

It only shows that someone updated the field, but without the information about the old and new value.

!Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 11.29.10.png|width=381,height=94!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: People field changes are not visible on the History tab on team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you move issues between two Team-managed projects, Jira will clear all values from custom fields even though you select to retain these values:
 !Screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the issue for a Team-managed project
# Click on the top-right menu (*. . .*) > Move
# Select another Team-managed project and click to Retain values

h3. Expected Results
The custom field values should be moved to the new project

h3. Actual Results

The custom fields appear blank

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving an issue between two Team-managed projects remove all custom field values

fields.description:
In the old issue view, when the admin shares the issue with multiple people, they will be able to see other users with whom the issue is being shared in the email notification received. Screenshot below
 !image-2021-06-21-16-51-29-525.png|thumbnail! 

However, in the new issue view, the user will not be able to see with whom the same issue was shared by the admin. Screenshot below
fields.summary: "Also shared with" option in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to enter Japanese properly when searching for issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a project and click "Issues"
 # Switch to Japanese IME and type "tesuto" in text box

h3. Expected Results
"てすと" will be shown

h3. Actual Results
"tえsうtお" will be shown
 [^AtlassianSupport 2021-06-21 11.33.55.mov] 

h3. Workaround
* Copy the string "てすと" in advance and paste it into the text box
* Use advanced search
fields.summary: Unable to enter Japanese properly when searching for issues
Mail Handler to comment only with associated projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Application Link between JIRA Server & Confluence Cloud not showing JIRA Issue Summary /Status in Confluence Cloud
It returns an error Issued_ID- Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.

It appears that cloud jira will try to use the current host <example-domain>.atlassian.net by default instead of going to the application link, it will assume confluence and jira are on the same cloud env, and this can be seen in a har file.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Select Confluence pages gadget and search for a Confluence page from an on-prem Confluence server that is app linked to the Jira Cloud server. The page title should show in the drop-down search results but when select it will spit an error about there being no application link

h3. Expected Results
When putting in a search for a page the page should get pulled in.

h3. Actual Results
An error that no application link is set up happens even though there is and properly applink from Confluence server to Jira Cloud and the page will even show in the drop-down, but when it's selected this error occurs

h3. Workaround
Put the full URL for the Confluence page into the Confluence pages gadget and it will pull in the page properly.
fields.summary: Application Link between JIRA Server & Confluence Cloud not pulling in page searches through Confluence pages gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The descriptions of the fields are not displayed on issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the description of the fields on issue view

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Display description of the fields on issue view

fields.description:
h3. Suggested Solution
Increase the size of the field names on issue view.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Increase the size of field names

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
At the moment, the configure fields option in the Create screen stores one preference irrespective of project/issue type. 

In cases where in there are multiple issue types associated with different screen fields (which are not shared among the issue types), then the user cannot choose to configure fields per issue type.

h3. Suggestion:
Since it is possible to have multiple issue types within the same project linked to multiple screen fields, it would be great to have the ability to configure fields specific to issue types in the create screen
fields.summary: Ability to store more than one preference in the "Configure fields" option of the Create Screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There are multiple scrolling bars on issue view
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a single scrolling bar for both columns on issue view
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Add a single scrolling bar for both columns on issue view

fields.description:
Currently if you wish to add a custom priority, (server KB also applicable on cloud - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upload-custom-priority-icons-in-jira-788961156.html] ), there are three ways -
 * Find an image hosting solution
 * Upload the image on confluence and Jira issue, and fetch the URL
 * Fetch the icons from jira.atlassian.com

It would be great if we have a dedicated section to host the images or priority icon.
fields.summary: Feature to host Priority icons on Jira cloud itself

fields.description:
*Current behaviour* -

Currently the calendar feature in Jira has a hard limit of 100 issues which is too less and issues are displayed on this criteria - 

Hard limit 100 issues spanning from {{start of the month - 14 days}}  to {{end of the month + 14 days}}

This means that issues despite having due date in it will not show up on Calendar and this is confusing for users.

*Suggestion* -

Please increase the limit from 100.
fields.summary: Increase the limit on number of issues that can be displayed on Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we try to navigate to the sprint from a *Sprint Health Gadget* the quick filters in the board fail to render.
 !Image 2021-06-18 at 4.08.20 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 
 In subsequent attempts this starts to work again and the quick filters reappear.
 !Image 2021-06-18 at 4.10.32 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 
 It is evident from the Network logs collected, that in the failed attempt a call is made to _/rest/navigation/2/board/<id>?exclude=webItems.reports,webItems.home,webItems.gin_ which is not available in any subsequent attempt.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a fresh session, add a *Sprint Health gadget* to a dashboard. Give the page a couple of refreshes to ensure that its a fresh session.
 # After configuring a board and an active sprint from the board, click on the sprint name so that it takes you to the board.
 # After verifying that the quick filters don't appear, hit the back button from the browser and repeat the same action. Note that the quick filters reappear.
 # Go back to the dashboard and refresh the dashboard page and click the sprint name. The issue reappears.

*Replication video:* [^Screen Recording 2021-06-18 at 03.59.01 PM.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

The board should load with the quick filters.
h3. Actual Results

The quick filters don't appear in the first instant. But upon refreshing the board page or on making subsequent attempts, the filters reappear.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the board so that the quick filters reappear.
fields.summary: Quick filters don't appear on board when navigated from Sprint Health Gadget

fields.description:
At the moment in the Team-Managed Jira Software projects it is not possible to add a validator for transition if the field is required/mandatory.

In the Team-Managed Jira Service Management projects, there is
 " Remind people to update empty fields " rule with a custom message.

It will be nice to have a *Validators* or please add *Remind people to update empty fields* to JSW projects.
fields.summary: To add  Validators or  " Remind people to update empty fields " rule to JSW team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding or editing a Validator / Previous State Validator, there are no options to choose from.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On any transition, add a validator.
 # Select _Previous State Validator_
 # There will be no options to choose from.

h3. Expected Results

Should have similar options from Conditions
 !image-2021-06-17-17-03-04-340.png|width=405,height=209!
h3. Actual Results

There are no options to choose from

!image-2021-06-17-17-01-09-338.png|width=448,height=168!
h3. Workaround

You can use Conditions with the required parameter for a similar result on the workflow logic.
fields.summary: Adding a Validator (Previous State Validator	) on a workflow transition doesn't show the parameters to choose

fields.description:
The Automation Field Value Change Trigger does not allow you to select the Epic Link field to trigger actions based on an issue's Epic Link changing. It also does not allow you to select an issue's parent changing to trigger an action.

See here for more reference: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Cloud-Admins/Automation-Rule-Triggered-by-Change-in-Parent/td-p/1724967#U1727031
fields.summary: Automation Field Value Change Trigger should work with Parent or Epic Link changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Comment link does not land to the correct comment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a link to a comment

h3. Expected Results
Land in the correct comment from the link
h3. Actual Results
Lands in different comments and sometimes the comment is scrolled to the bottom of the viewport, and sometimes it gets partially cut off

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Comment link does not land to the correct comment
Automation for Jira: Access component leads

fields.description:
*Description*
If you have more than one _consecutive_ action configured in a rule, in such cases one _action_ does not wait for another _action_ to complete and in this case, the rule executes randomly though they are executed in order.

Suggestion
It would be great if we have an automation condition to validate if the previous action is completely executed before jumping into the consecutive action.
fields.summary: Automation conditions to validate if the previous action is completed.

fields.description: In Jira Server/Data center it is possible to change the format of the project key, this feature is not available in Cloud, and the request is to have this feature included. For context, this is the documentation for Jira Server/Data Center: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/changing-the-project-key-format-938847081.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/changing-the-project-key-format-938847081.html]
fields.summary: Add possibility of changing Project key pattern

fields.description:
Currently in Company managed projects the only way to know who has permissions to do or see something is by going to the project settings and looking at each permission. If the permission has roles or groups in it, then you need to go and look at each role (People's section of Project settings) and group (User management, only available for site admins). 

Additional to this, you can go and check a permission scheme, and see permission by permission, but it is not possible to search for permissions related to a specific group, role or user.

For Team managed projects, since they are self contained, the only way to see about access is to look in the project itself.

The request is to provide a product level report where a Jira administrator can see all the information needed for an administrator to have a full view of what is the current permission status, showing information like:
Project, Type of project, Permission, User, How they get this permission (directly, through a group, a role, etc.). 

The idea is to be able to generate the report with different combinations:
* For all projects/a specific project
* For a specific group (which would bring all the users that have permission through that group)/ specific role/specific user .

This would bring all the visibility an admin would require to know exactly who has access and to what, as well as being useful for audits in addition to be really helpful now that the Permission helper is not available in the new issue view.

One last thing is that ideally this information should be exportable as well.
fields.summary: Provide a detailed dynamic permissions report

fields.description:
Ability to re-use issue numbers in the same project

The customer would like to re-use the issue number if they delete an issue in the same project.
fields.summary: Ability to re-use issue numbers in the same project

fields.description:
Today there is no option to retrieve the get a comment rendered in HTML (renderedBody) to be included in the webhook execution payload using any of the three comment triggers.

It would be desired to have an option included for this specific type of trigger to allow for passing down the renderedBody property.
fields.summary: Add option to include renderedBody in comments webhooks

fields.description:
If you’re creating or editing issues, you can query a project’s [_createmeta_|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-issue-createmeta-get] or an issue’s [_editmeta_|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-changelog-get] information to view supported fields and operations.

You can retrieve the metadata for both operations by visiting:
 * GET /rest/api/3/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=<string>&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields

 * GET /rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/editmeta

This JSON returns all fields that can be used in the {{Additional fields}}, including their possible operations and values, however, it doesn't not include the *watchers* field.

It would be usefulll to be able to manage watchers using Automation Advanced field editing.

https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-field-editing-json/
fields.summary: Include WATCHERS on Advanced field editing - JSON

fields.description:
Some issues are multi-person collaboration, person A wrote multiple
comments.  Person B and Person C want to reply to different comments from
person A separately.

I would like to be able to reply directly below the comment. It will
be difficult to distinguish which comment each person responded to.
fields.summary: A Reply button under each comment so can reply directly under that particular comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a subtask under an issue with team assigned, the subtask does not get the team field appearing in it as the parent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Create a story
 # Select a team for the story
 # Commit it to Jira
 # Create a subtask under the newly created story
 # Commit the subtask

h3. Expected Results

The subtask should have the team field appearing in the new issue view.
h3. Actual Results

The subtask does not have the team field visible in the assigned to it in the new issue view
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Team field is not visible on the subtask in new issue view

fields.description: When a user is deleted, add the ability to select a different user to become the assignee, reporter, etc. of the issues that belonged to the deleted user so that this doesn't have to be done as a separate process manually.
fields.summary: When a user is deleted, add the ability to select a different user to become the assignee, reporter, etc. of the issues that belonged to the deleted user

fields.description:
Currently in the New Issue View, it is possible to have a quick preview of MS Office file types (docx, pptx, xlsx) in the 'strip view' layout. This is working as designed based on the tickets below:
 * [New Issue View won't preview some attachments|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70279]
 * [Attachment Preview for Word and Excel Files in JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64979]

Although, when clicking on the preview and looking at the file in the extended view, the formatting is poor as seen [in the video linked here|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/6122329/6122329_Jira_Excel_Viewing_Experience.mp4].

The request here is to enhance the attachment preview rendering and allow the ability to edit the docs from within this view as well.
fields.summary: Enhancement to MS Office files attachment preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When comparing the values between the History tab on an issue and the Worklog tab, sometimes the Time Spent entries won't match the entries listed on the History Tab

h3. Expected Results

Both Worklog and History must match the total of logged work.

h3. Actual Results

There are differences in the number of logged hours between each other.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Worklog entries does not match History Time Spent entries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to create issue in MS Teams, we currently can only see upto 20 projects in the list. It would be great to have a scroll bar displaying all the project. 
h3. Workaround

Type the project name in the box it would list the project required.
fields.summary: All the projects are not listed for selection in MS Teams Jira bot

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The edit meta cache used by automation rules to edit fields in an issue is not invalidated (even with re-fetch action) causing automation rule to fail (in some cases).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field "Field A" with field context limited to "Issue type A"
# Create an automation rule wherein issue was initially in "Issue type B" and was changed to "Issue type A" via Edit issue action. 
# Then using another Edit issue action, try to edit the field "Field A". Note that "Field A" has context set only to "Issue type A" and not "Issue type B".


h3. Expected Results
Field A is correctly updated  (the edit meta cache is invalidated with Re-fetch action component) 

h3. Actual Results
An error message is returned, saying that "Field A" is not in the Issue Edit screen for "Issue Type A", even if it actually is. 

This is because, even though the issue type was changed from B to A and the "Re-fetch issue" action component is used, the edit issue action still relies on the data returned when running by /rest/api/2/issue/<issuekey>/editmeta to determine fields that are editable against "Issue Type B". The edit meta cache is not invalidated when changing issue type, and hence the attempt to update the field fails.


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: Invalidate create/edit meta cache when issue type is edited

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, you can only search for rules by name.

h3. Proposed solution
* Search for rules by name
* Search for rules with types of actions (e.g. edit issue)
* Search for rules with field value text (so you can figure out which rule is performing a specific edit, or sends a particular e-mail etc)
* Search for rules by owner
fields.summary: Ability to search rule list for rules that perform specific actions

fields.description:
Attachments made in a comment become a top-level attachment, leading to confusion.

It breaks expectations of the person who comments for a limited audience, plus is notifies broader watching audience of newly added attachment with 0 context

Suggestion - introduce a mechanism to link attachments to a security level of comment in which these attachments were added.
fields.summary: Better handling of attachments made in a comment with limited audience
